item.title: Trump restricts funding for 'gain-of-function' research — calling it dangerous
item.description: President Trump issued an executive order Monday banning federal funding for any research abroad that involves a field of scientific study known as "gain-of-function" research. Here's what it means.

item.title: States sue Trump administration for blocking the development of wind energy
item.description: Attorneys general from 17 states and D.C. are challenging an executive order Trump signed on his first day in office pausing approvals, permits and loans for all wind energy projects.

item.title: Former Palantir workers condemn company's work with Trump administration
item.description: In a rare rebuke, more than a dozen former workers of the powerful data-mining and surveillance company say the firm's work with the Trump administration violates the company's founding principles.

item.title: Israel's Plans for Gaza
item.description: Israel's cabinet has approved plans for Gaza that include expanding the war, taking territory with the intent to keep troops there, and major shifts in the way food and aid are distributed. Our correspondent in Tel Aviv tells us what are in the plans and what they could mean for Gaza.

item.title: 'James' wins 2025 Pulitzer Prize for fiction
item.description: The 2025 Pulitzer Prizes were announced Monday afternoon. Percival Everett won the award for fiction for his novel James, a powerful re-imagination of Huckleberry Finn.
